item.title: Stephanie add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "In such business Action is eloquence, and the eyes of th’ ignorant More learned than the ears." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "If people bring so much courage to this world the world has to kill them to break them, so of course it kills them. The world breaks every one and afterward many are strong at the broken places. But those that will not break it kills. It kills the very good and the very gentle and the very brave impartially. If you are none of these you can be sure it will kill you too but there will be no special hurry." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Orson Wells
item.description: "We're born alone, we live alone, we die alone. Only through our love and friendship can we create the illusion for the moment that we're not alone." -- Orson Wells

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Orson Welles
item.description: "A toast, Jedediah, to love on my terms. Those are the only terms anybody ever knows - his own." -- Orson Welles

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "Chastity—the most unnatural of all the sexual perversions, he added parenthetically, out of [author:Remy de Gourmont|78190]." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "I, with a deeper instinct, choose a man who compels my strength, who makes enormous demands on me, who does not doubt my courage or my toughness, who does not believe me naïve or innocent, who has the courage to treat me like a woman." -- Anaïs Nin
